item.title: Walker’s career on the line - The Australian
item.description:
Walker’s career on the line  The Australian

Three years ago, he was fortunate to escape with his life after an ill-informed decision to dabble with prescription drugs. Now Dylan Walker is fighting to save his career. Walker was charged with assaulting his fiancee Alexandra Ivkovic — the mother of his four-month-old son — in the early hours of Friday morning, Manly immediately standing him down from training as they digested another setback in a year that was already an annus horribilis. They have had players breaking curfew, coaching dramas and now the nadir — allegations that Walker left Ivkovic with cuts to her hands and her feet a...

item.title: Dylan Walker stood down by Manly following arrest for assault charges - The Guardian
item.description:
Dylan Walker stood down by Manly following arrest for assault charges  The Guardian

Manly NRL star Dylan Walker has been stood down from training after being charged with assault following an alleged domestic violence incident involving his partner on Sydney’s Northern Beaches. The woman, 24, suffered minor cuts to her shoulder, leg and feet at a home in Dee Why, on Thursday afternoon and was treated by paramedics at the scene. Related: Wayne Bennett 'happy to be sacked' by Brisbane Broncos Walker, also 24, was later arrested and charged with common assault and assault occasioning actual bodily harm. The Sea Eagles centre was driven away from Manly Police Station by coach ...

item.title: Meet Valentine Holmes, The Aussie Rugby Star Aiming At The NFL - Forbes
item.description:
Meet Valentine Holmes, The Aussie Rugby Star Aiming At The NFL  Forbes

Valentine Holmes The pathway to the NFL for most athletes is simple: do well in high school, get a college scholarship, do well in college football and get yourself drafted into the big time. For one man in April’s draft, the path will have been a little different. Valentine Holmes, an Australian rugby league player, will take his place at the Combine with an entire nation watching his moves as intensely as the NFL coaches. While many potential NFL draftees will already be prominent stars, few will be able to match Holmes in the “been there, done that” stakes: he has won the National Rugby ...

item.title: 'I was happy to be sacked': Wayne Bennett doesn't regret messy Broncos exit - ABC News
item.description:
'I was happy to be sacked': Wayne Bennett doesn't regret messy Broncos exit  ABC News

Wayne Bennett strode out of the Redfern Oval tunnel for his first Rabbitohs training session just two days after being sacked by the Brisbane Broncos and made a beeline for a lone fan who was yelling, "thank you, thank you". Key points: - Wayne Bennett says he has a "clear conscience" following his sacking from the Broncos - Bennett refused to comment on the speculation there is bad blood between him and Anthony Seibold - He is contracted to coach the Rabbitohs for the next three seasons There was a quick handshake before the 68-year-old Bennett strode past the contingent of waiting media a...

item.title: Analysis: After three decades, the Broncos finally move on from Wayne Bennett - ABC News
item.description:
Analysis: After three decades, the Broncos finally move on from Wayne Bennett  ABC News

By Grandstand's Quentin Hull When the mushroom cloud surrounding rugby league's messiest divorce dissipates, new Brisbane Broncos coach Anthony Seibold will be afforded a clean air only one man has ever known. Once, and for all, it can be written in stone that Wayne Bennett will never coach the Broncos again. Seibold enters a realm former Brisbane coaches Ivan Henjak and Anthony Griffin could only dream of. The National Rugby League's biggest club has been re-born. The Broncos have only ever existed in times with Bennett either in control or being discussed as a returning saviour to guide t...

item.title: 'They've been in tears': Souths coach blames Wayne Bennett for family toll during coaching saga - ABC News
item.description:
'They've been in tears': Souths coach blames Wayne Bennett for family toll during coaching saga  ABC News

South Sydney coach Anthony Seibold has "had a gutful" of Brisbane counterpart Wayne Bennett following his decision to stay with the Broncos, saying it has had an unnecessary impact on his children. Key points: - Anthony Seibold expected Wayne Bennett to step down as Broncos coach a year early - Seibold was set to be unveiled as the Broncos coach for the 2019 season last Friday - Bennett says he is "happy" with how he has handled the coaching situation Seibold and Bennett were set to swap coaching positions at the Broncos and Rabbitohs in the 2020 NRL season but speculation was rife on Frida...

item.title: Shaun Johnson signs three-year deal with Cronulla Sharks - The Guardian
item.description:
Shaun Johnson signs three-year deal with Cronulla Sharks  The Guardian

Kiwi superstar Shaun Johnson has been given a chance to secure his legacy after signing a three-year NRL deal with Cronulla. Johnson was on Saturday spotted in the Shire meeting with coach Shane Flanagan and senior players Wade Graham and Andrew Fifita before officially putting pen to paper on a long-term deal. Related: England end Test series on sour note with thrashing by New Zealand While the Sharks were always the front-runners to secure the New Zealand Test playmaker’s signature after he was granted a release from the Warriors, it was rumoured he was only set to sign a one-year deal wi...

item.title: Jarryd Hayne charged with aggravated sexual assault by NSW Police - ABC News
item.description:
Jarryd Hayne charged with aggravated sexual assault by NSW Police  ABC News

Rugby league star Jarryd Hayne has been charged with aggravated sexual assault after an alleged incident in the New South Wales Hunter region on NRL grand final night. Key points: - Hayne was charged on Monday and granted conditional bail - The 30-year-old is due to appear in court on December 10 - Hayne is currently out of contract ahead of the 2019 NRL season NSW Police confirmed the charge, which came after a 26-year-oldwoman lodged a complaint to the NRL Integrity Unit earlier this year. Hayne, 30, was questioned at the Ryde Police Station on Monday afternoon and later charged with "agg...

item.title: Explosive Hayne ‘bite’ claims emerge - The Advertiser
item.description:
Explosive Hayne ‘bite’ claims emerge  The Advertiser

A reticent Hayne said nothing to reporters as the out-of-contract NRL star reported to police to satisfy his strict bail conditions for the first time. Hayne, 30, was charged with aggravated sexual assault and inflicting actual bodily harm after handing himself into Ryde police station on Monday afternoon. He was released in the early hours of Tuesday morning after first reporting to the station about 4pm on Monday. Police will allege the 26-year-old woman was bitten by Hayne, causing profuse bleeding that led to her going to hospital, The Daily Telegraph reports. It is also alleged Hayne h...

item.title: More weight and speed required for Holmes to make it in NFL, Scotts says - ABC News
item.description:
More weight and speed required for Holmes to make it in NFL, Scotts says  ABC News

Valentine Holmes needs to put on up to 10 kilograms and increase his speed if he is to succeed in the NFL, according to Australia's pioneer in the sport Colin Scotts. Holmes has reportedly decided he wants to leave the NRL and pursue a career in the United States, following in the footsteps of Jarryd Hayne in 2014, News Corp says. He will meet with Cronulla chief executive Barry Russell this week to further discuss his future, but there is some suggestion he could head overseas almost immediately. Holmes has long harboured an ambition to play in the NFL, and both he and Jason Taumalolo tria...

item.title: 'He could be a raging success': Valentine Holmes released by Sharks to chase NFL dream - ABC News
item.description:
'He could be a raging success': Valentine Holmes released by Sharks to chase NFL dream  ABC News

Queensland and Australia star Valentine Holmes has been granted an immediate release by Cronulla and pursue a career in the NFL. Key points: - Valentine Holmes could follow in the footsteps of Jarryd Hayne, who played in the NFL in 2015 - Holmes has been warned he will need to add up to 10 kilograms in weight to make the NFL - The Sharks have given Holmes the opportunity to return to the NRL in 2019 But the Sharks have left the door open for Holmes to return to the NRL with the club next season. The Sharks had been hoping to re-sign Holmes to a five-year contract extension, but they refused...

item.title: Jarryd Hayne arrested by sex crime detectives - The Advertiser
item.description:
Jarryd Hayne arrested by sex crime detectives  The Advertiser

Hayne arrived at Ryde police station at 4pm by appointment with his player manager Wayne Beavis and met with detectives about allegations he assaulted the woman in the Newcastle area. He has not yet spoken publicly about the claims. It was reported last week that a woman complained to police after the two had sex at a house in the Hunter Valley on September 30. The pair met on social media before meeting in person when Hayne was in the Hunter Region for a night out. It is understood they had been corresponding in the time leading up to September 30. The alleged victim made a complaint to th...

item.title: Valentine Holmes free to pursue NFL career after Cronulla release fullback - The Guardian
item.description:
Valentine Holmes free to pursue NFL career after Cronulla release fullback  The Guardian

Valentine Holmes’ NRL career is on ice after Cronulla granted the fullback’s wish for an immediate release from his contract on Tuesday to pursue a career in the NFL. The Sharks had been trying to tie Holmes down to a five-year extension, which would have made him the highest paid player in the club’s history, but the club said it had “no option” but to allow him to leave. Under the terms of the release, if Holmes is unsuccessful in the NFL and wants to return to the NRL in 2019, he will not be eligible to play for any other club. Related: Jarryd Hayne interviewed by police, reportedly over...

item.title: Jarryd Hayne reportedly under investigation over allegations of sexual assault - The Guardian
item.description:
Jarryd Hayne reportedly under investigation over allegations of sexual assault  The Guardian

Jarryd Hayne’s immediate NRL future appears even more uncertain with the out-of-contract star reportedly being investigated over allegations of sexual assault. Without an NRL club for next season, Hayne is the subject of an investigation by the New South Wales sex crimes squad following an incident on grand final night, according to the Nine Network. The report claimed the woman said she had suffered injuries during a sexual encounter with Hayne in the Hunter Valley on 30 September and that she had photographs to back up her story. It is understood the alleged victim was interviewed by the ...

item.title: Australia coach Mal Meninga takes NRL role with Gold Coast Titans - The Guardian
item.description:
Australia coach Mal Meninga takes NRL role with Gold Coast Titans  The Guardian

Gold Coast have landed a recruitment coup, luring national team coach Mal Meninga to the NRL club as head of performance and culture. Meninga was on the Gold Coast on Wednesday and will begin immediately in the role as he relocates with his family from Canberra on a three-year contract. Meninga will remain Australian coach as he balances his new role, which will include mentoring second-year NRL coach Garth Brennan. Club chairman Dennis Watt said Meninga would be used across the business both on and off the field. Related: The more England beat New Zealand, the less they fear NRL players “T...

item.title: 'Manly man' Des Hasler welcomed back as head coach - ABC News
item.description:
'Manly man' Des Hasler welcomed back as head coach  ABC News

Manly is in Des Hasler's blood and after a seven-year hiatus, he is returning to the helm of the northern beaches club as head coach next year. Hasler played for the club from 1984 to 1993 and went on to coach the team from 2004 to 2011 — winning two premierships titles — and he still lives on the northern beaches. "It's great to be back coaching…looking forward to getting back to that day-to-day interaction and work with the players," he said. Manly chief executive Scott Penn said the deal took three weeks to work out, but the players were still on break so have not heard from the new coac...

item.title: South Sydney Rabbitohs sign England head coach Wayne Bennett - The Guardian
item.description:
South Sydney Rabbitohs sign England head coach Wayne Bennett  The Guardian

South Sydney Rabbitohs will not stand in Wayne Bennett’s way if he wants to continue his role as England coach alongside his club duties after confirming the appointment of the 68-year-old for the 2020 and 2021 seasons. Bennett’s deal with the Rugby Football League expires at the end of next year. He is currently in England coaching the national side in their three-match Test series against New Zealand and is also set to lead Great Britain on their tour of the southern hemisphere in 2019. Last week, Bennett reiterated that he would like to continue in his national role beyond that and South...
